tweets.content: @odi_madrid: Mañana, antes de las "Closing remarks", @ocorcho hablará de #opendata portals en OjoAlData100 initiative #IODC16…https://internationalopendataconfer2016.sched.org/event/7PVj/the-ojoaldata100-initiative-for-harmonising-datasets-in-smart-city-open-data-portals?iframe=no&w=&sidebar=yes&bg=no …

info: The ojoaldata100 initiative looks towards data interoperability among smart cities' data. They proposed a catalogue of a hundred datasets, including their detail, that should be published by the city.

session.description: The OjoAlData100 initiative for harmonising datasets in Smart City open data portals

conference_notes:
Some data collected in the project was: air quality, real-time transit, traffic accidents, building permits, crime statistics, traffic signalling, etc.¨Some public existing standards has guided the compilation of this list, namely UNE178301 norm: Open Data for Smart cities, World Council on City Data (ISO 37120) and a few others. The number of participants in this project is 37: 6 private companies, 10 city councils, 3 regions, 3 ministries and 2 other organisations.
As Mr. Abella said: "Without homogenization open city data will not reach their full potential", and Ojoaldata project is focused on helping to the  development of better and useful services for citizens
name: The OjoAlData100 Initiative for Harmonising Datasets in Smart City Open Data Portals
